item.title: Dota 2: Ranking System Explained (All Ranks Listed)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • What Are Ranks In Dota 2?
  • All Ranks In Dota 2

Dota 2 is one of the best MOBA games where you must compete with other players. If you want to improve as a player, you must learn how its ranking system works. This article will explain the ranking system in Dota 2 . Additionally, it will include a list of all the ranks with details on how much MMR you need to reach each one.

What Are Ranks In Dota 2?

Your rank in Dota 2 represents how good you are at this game and determines how strong your enemies will be. So, to become a better player and compete with tougher opponents, you will have to increase your rank MMR.

How Does MMR Work In Dota 2?

MMR (Matchmaking Rating) in Dota 2 is a special numerical score that determines your rank . You can earn MMR by winning matches, and there are many factors that can affect how much you get. For example, if your opponents have more MMR than you, then you will receive more points for defeating them. Still, you will get around 25 MMR per win and lose 25 in case of defeat.

If you are a newcomer, you will need to play until you can participate in ranked games and calibration matches. This feature will be unlocked after you have played 100 hours .

All Ranks In Dota 2

There are 8 ranks in Dota 2 , each divided into five tiers . The only exception is the Immortal rank, which is the highest one. Here is a list of all Dota 2 ranks and how much MMR you need to reach them:

  • Herald 1 – 0-154 MMR
  • Herald 2 – 154-308 MMR
  • Herald 3 – 308-462 MMR
  • Herald 4 – 462-616 MMR
  • Herald 5 – 616-770 MMR
  • Guardian 1 – 770-924 MMR
  • Guardian 2 – 924-1078 MMR
  • Guardian 3 – 1078-1232 MMR
  • Guardian 4 – 1232-1387 MMR
  • Guardian 5 – 1386-1540 MMR
  • Crusader 1 – 1540-1694 MMR
  • Crusader 2 – 1694-1848 MMR
  • Crusader 3 – 1848-2002 MMR
  • Crusader 4 – 2002-2156 MMR
  • Crusader 5 – 2156-2310 MMR
  • Archon 1 – 2310-2464 MMR
  • Archon 2 – 2464-2618 MMR
  • Archon 3 – 2618-2772 MMR
  • Archon 4 – 2772-2926 MMR
  • Archon 5 – 2926-3080 MMR
  • Legend 1 – 3080-3234 MMR
  • Legend 2 – 3234-3388 MMR
  • Legend 3 – 3388-3542 MMR
  • Legend 4 – 3542-3696 MMR
  • Legend 5 – 3696-3850 MMR
  • Ancient 1 – 3850-4004 MMR
  • Ancient 2 – 4004-4158 MMR
  • Ancient 3 – 4158-4312 MMR
  • Ancient 4 – 4312-4466 MMR
  • Ancient 5 – 4466-4620 MMR
  • Divine 1 – 4620-4820 MMR
  • Divine 2 – 4820-5020 MMR
  • Divine 3 – 5020-5220 MMR
  • Divine 4 – 5220-5420 MMR
  • Divine 5 – 5420-5620 MMR
  • Immortal – 5620+ MMR

The ranking system in Dota 2 allows you to progress through different ranks and helps you estimate your current skill. If you try to reach higher ranks, you will be forced to learn various nuances of the game mechanics. Over time, with practice, you will become a better player.

item.title: MultiVersus: All Trophies/Achievements & How To Get Them
item.description:
In modern video gaming, it is common and often expected that a game will come with a series of Achievements or Trophies. These Trophies and Achievements can usually be earned in most titles by meeting in-game milestones, making rare discoveries, completing quests, and more.

As with many other games, the multi-fandom 2D fighter title, MultiVersus , has a lengthy list of Trophies that can be acquired by players. From simple objectives such as utilizing the Toast mechanic, or more complex challenges, such as getting Ringouts while using a specific ability, completionists will need to know how they can successfully achieve each Trophy related to MultiVersus . To help assist with this, every MultiVersus Trophy, as well as some tips for unlocking them have been included in the guide below.

MultiVersus - Achievement / Trophy Guide

Trophy

How to Unlock

Tier

Tips For Unlocking

Credit Where It's Due

Give out 5 Toasts to other players

Bronze

  • Toast can only be given out to players during the results screen of a match.
  • If you run out of Toast, you can purchase more with Gold.

Nice Speech

Give out 10 Toasts to other players

Silver

  • Toast can only be given out to players during the results screen of a match.
  • If you run out of Toast, you can purchase more with Gold.

Toast Master

Give out 100 Toasts to other players

Gold

  • Toast can only be given out to players during the results screen of a match.
  • If you run out of Toast, you can purchase more with Gold.

Run it Back

Accept 100 rematches

Bronze

  • Rematch Trophies can be most easily farmed by playing against bots, as all players need to accept a rematch for it to work, and bots will automatically ask for a rematch each time.

Matchmaker

Play 1 matchmade game

Bronze

  • To earn this Trophy, players only need to play one online game. It does not matter if it is against another player, AI, or a custom game.

You Mean Business

Get 30 Ringouts

Bronze

  • To earn a Ringout, you will need to knock your opponent out of the field of play during a match.
  • Sometimes, the blast zone may shrink during a match, giving an opportunity for much easier Ringouts.

You're Getting Pretty Good At This!

Get 50 Ringouts

Silver

  • To earn a Ringout, you will need to knock your opponent out of the field of play during a match.
  • Sometimes, the blast zone may shrink during a match, giving an opportunity for much easier Ringouts.

Bun-Puncher Supreme

Get 100 Ringouts

Gold

  • To earn a Ringout, you will need to knock your opponent out of the field of play during a match.
  • Sometimes, the blast zone may shrink during a match, giving an opportunity for much easier Ringouts.

Stepping Out

Win 10 matchmade games

Bronze

  • Matchmade games can be through online matches with strangers or custom matches with friends.
  • The easiest way to quickly complete Trophies involving matchmade games is to play against just one friend who is willing to help, hit the Ringout on the enemy friend for victory, and then repeat this process.

Proving Yourself

Win 100 matchmade games

Silver

  • Matchmade games can be through online matches with strangers or custom matches with friends.
  • The easiest way to quickly complete Trophies involving matchmade games is to play against just one friend who is willing to help, hit the Ringout on the enemy friend for victory, and then repeat this process.

The Throne Is Yours

Win 300 matchmade games

Gold

  • Matchmade games can be through online matches with strangers or custom matches with friends.
  • The easiest way to quickly complete Trophies involving matchmade games is to play against just one friend who is willing to help, hit the Ringout on the enemy friend for victory, and then repeat this process.

Bring a Friend

Get 10 Double Ringouts

Bronze

  • Double Ringouts are achieved by scoring a Ringout on two players at the same time, or from the same attack.
  • Notably, Taz is a great choice for achieving Double Ringouts, as his tornado spin attack can hit multiple enemies and times.

Ringouts Are Better In Pairs

Get 25 Double Ringouts

Silver

  • Double Ringouts are achieved by scoring a Ringout on two players at the same time, or from the same attack.
  • Notably, Taz is a great choice for achieving Double Ringouts, as his tornado spin attack can hit multiple enemies and times..

Watch Your Step

Get 10 Ringouts using your spike

Bronze

  • To spike, players will need to downward strike their opponents while they are in the air.
  • Because of this, one of the best characters for easily achieving spike Ringouts is Finn, due to his ability to consistently knock enemies into the air.

Going Down?

Get 50 Ringouts using your spike

Silver

  • To spike, players will need to downward strike their opponents while they are in the air.
  • Because of this, one of the best characters for easily achieving spike Ringouts is Finn, due to his ability to consistently knock enemies into the air.

Ground Floor: Ringouts

Get 100 Ringouts using your spike

Gold

  • To spike, players will need to downward strike their opponents while they are in the air.
  • Because of this, one of the best characters for easily achieving spike Ringouts is Finn, due to his ability to consistently knock enemies into the air.

Aerial Specialist

Get 10 Ringouts using the top of the Blast Zone

Bronze

  • Will usually be automatically completed during the process of completion on other Ringout-based Trophies.

Southpaw Specialist

Get 10 Ringouts using the left-side of the Blast Zone

Bronze

  • Will usually be automatically completed during the process of completion on other Ringout-based Trophies.

Rightie Specialist

Get 10 Ringouts using the right-side of the Blast Zone

Bronze

  • Will usually be automatically completed during the process of completion on other Ringout-based Trophies.

Spike Specialist

Get 10 Ringouts using the bottom of the Blast Zone

Bronze

  • Will usually be automatically completed during the process of completion on other Ringout-based Trophies.

Watch Your Head

Get 20 Ringouts with a Projectile

Bronze

  • 'Projectiles' are items that will spawn during your matches, providing your character with an ability that deals damage or other effects.
  • In addition to the random ones that spawn in matches, some characters deal damage with Projectiles as part of one of their abilities.
  • Shaggy is one of the easiest characters for securing Projectile Ringouts, due to his sandwich Projectiles.

Catch This

Get 50 Ringouts with a Projectile

Silver

  • 'Projectiles' are items that will spawn during your matches, providing your character with an ability that deals damage or other effects.
  • In addition to the random ones that spawn in matches, some characters deal damage with Projectiles as part of one of their abilities.
  • Shaggy is one of the easiest characters for securing Projectile Ringouts, due to his sandwich Projectiles.

Distanced Damage Dealer

Get 200 Ringouts with a Projectile

Gold

  • 'Projectiles' are items that will spawn during your matches, providing your character with an ability that deals damage or other effects.
  • In addition to the random ones that spawn in matches, some characters deal damage with Projectiles as part of one of their abilities.
  • Shaggy is one of the easiest characters for securing Projectile Ringouts, due to his sandwich Projectiles.

Social Butterfly

Play 25 matches in a party

Bronze

  • To achieve this trophy, you will need to play a combined total of matches while teamed up in a party with a friend.
  • Win and loss both count towards progress of total matches played.

Life of the Party

Play 100 matches in a party

Silver

  • To achieve this trophy, you will need to play a combined total of matches while teamed up in a party with a friend.
  • Win and loss both count towards progress of total matches played.

Party Animal

Play 500 matches in a party

Gold

  • To achieve this trophy, you will need to play a combined total of matches while teamed up in a party with a friend.
  • Win and loss both count towards progress of total matches played.

Signature Slammer

Get 10 low-damage Ringouts

Bronze

  • Low-damage Ringouts occur when your character knocks a character with under 100 damage out of the field.
  • This is most easily achieved with the assistance of a friend.

Trophy Master

Earn all other Trophies to collect this Trophy

Platinum

  • Achieve all other Trophies

item.title: Project Zomboid: 8 Best Melee Weapons, Ranked
item.description:
Highlights

  • Electric guitars are great early-game weapons and provide good damage, but high stamina cost.
  • Nightsticks are essential backup weapons with great durability and effective for zombie clearance.
  • The baseball bat is reliable and balanced with superior range and durability for efficient kills.

The most used tool in any Project Zomboid player's arsenal is their trusty melee weapon of choice. With an escape plan, guns are excellent for clearing regions, but their loud noise will always attract unwanted attention. The game has six weapon types that all can be leveled separately.

Leveling the weapon type results in increased efficiency and will turn the player into a zombie shredder at higher levels. Some weapon groups are better suited to handling larger groups of zeds, while others excel at quick takedowns. As far as melee weapons are concerned, it's hard to go wrong with the following options.

8 Electric Guitars

Key Characteristics: Great Early Game Weapon

  • Damage: 0.8-1.2
  • Range: 0.61–1.35
  • Attack Speed: 1.1

During the early game, players are often scrambling to get their hands on a reliable weapon. Many homes will have an electric guitar and players should consider using it at the start of the game.

The electric guitar does great damage for the early game and is a break-and-dump type weapon until gamers get their hands on a better weapon. The main downside of the electric guitar is its high stamina cost to use, as players will quickly become exhausted when swinging it.

7 Nightstick

Key Characteristics: Backup Weapon

  • Damage: 0.6-1.1
  • Range: 0.61–1.12
  • Attack Speed: 1

No matter what weapon players are using, having a backup weapon is a must-have. A nightstick is a one-handed belt weapon that can save lives if players run out of ammo or their main weapon breaks.

The weapon has great durability and can easily be found on police zombies. The weapon only weighs 1.5 and is an essential bring-along if players are planning a long zombie clearance. Players with a high short blunt skill level will get the most out of this weapon as its damage will be increased.

6 Baseball Bat

Key Characteristics: Reliable & Balanced

  • Damage: 0.8-1.1
  • Range: 0.61–1.5
  • Attack Speed: 1

The baseball bat is perhaps the most iconic weapon for tacking down zombies. Players can immediately spawn with a baseball bat if they turn on the starter kit in the custom sandbox settings. Baseball bats are commonly found in regular homes.

While the baseball bat has superior range, attack speed, and durability to the spiked baseball bat, its lower damage will be felt on tougher zombies. Characters with higher strength will turn the baseball bat into a murder machine.

5 Spiked Baseball Bat

Key Characteristics: Easy Damage Upgrade

  • Damage: 1-1.5
  • Range: 0.61–1.28
  • Attack Speed: 0.95

Crafting a spiked baseball bat requires a baseball bat, five nails, and a hammer. The crafted weapon has higher damage at the cost of a slight nerf to weapon speed, durability, and range. Higher damage weapons will mean that players will have to swing less, thus incurring less fatigue.

Since baseball bats fall into the long blunt category, they will receive a damage bonus at levels 3 and 7. Repairing the spiked baseball bat is easy as it uses nails and glue.

4 Crowbar

Key Characteristics: High Durability

  • Damage: 0.6-1.5
  • Range: 0.61–1.25
  • Attack Speed: 1

The crowbar is another preferred weapon of many Project Zomboid players. The weapon boasts the highest durability in the game, but cannot be repaired. Players will find enough crowbars in their journey to always have one ready for combat. After the first ten in-game days, zombies will spawn with a crowbar impaled to their back.

To make up for its average damage, the crowbar is a versatile powerhouse capable of removing barricades, picking up furniture, and prying open locked doors with Common Sense, a popular mod for Project Zomboid .

3 Axe

Key Characteristics: High Damage & Durability

  • Damage: 0.8-2
  • Range: 0.61–1.2
  • Attack Speed: 1

A fan-favorite weapon of many players, the axe is easy to find in fire stations and gives excellent damage and durability. Players starting with the firefighter or lumberjack profession will have a head start in the axe skill and can start annihilating zombies faster. Players with a headstart in the axe skill will obtain the damage bonuses faster.

The axe can be repaired and will last players a long time. Players should use another axe type to chop wood and keep the regular axe strictly for combat use to get the most out of their weapon.

2 Katana

Key Characteristics: Highest Damage

  • Damage: 8
  • Range: 0.61–1.4
  • Attack Speed: 1

Most melee weapons and guns are easy to find, but this rule certainly does not factor in the katana. The katana has the highest damage in the game, surpassing all melee and ranged weapons. Usually, one hit from the weapon will eliminate every zombie.

The major downside to the weapon is the inability to repair it. Players attached to their katana can find good mods that will allow the weapon to be repaired. On top of its lack of vanilla repairability, the katana has a very low durability rating and shouldn't be relied on for consistent use by players.

1 Spear With Machete

Key Characteristics: Excellent Range

  • Damage: 1.3-2
  • Range: 0.98–1.55
  • Attack Speed: 1

As rare as machetes are, it would be a waste not to craft them into a spear with a machete. In Build 42, players may craft new and unique weapons that are easy to make and provide superb damage. For now, rationing machetes into spear machetes is the best use of materials.

The spear with a machete has the longest range in the game and offers amazing durability and damage. The one-hit kill potential of the spear also elevates the machete to a higher level. Players can level their spear skill with other spears to get the most out of the spear with a machete.

item.title: Nintendo Patent May Hint at Big Switch UI Changes
item.description:
Highlights

  • Nintendo's new patent could revolutionize game selection process for players, displaying snapshots of save game data on menu screens.
  • The patent hints at potential changes to Switch software, sparking speculation about future console developments by the gaming giant.
  • While the patented system shows promise, it is uncertain if Nintendo will implement this convenient game selection feature on current or future devices.

A patent published by Nintendo shows an interesting new user interface system that would display snapshots of save game data on a game selection menu, which aims to make it easier for players to remember their previous gameplay sessions when selecting a game to play. Several recent Nintendo Switch patents have raised speculation about planned changes to the existing Switch software, though there is the potential that Nintendo could be testing new features for future devices.

One of the most prominent names in gaming, Nintendo has served as a dominant force in video games for several decades and is showing no signs of slowing down. Rumors have been running rampant for years about the next generation of Nintendo consoles and whether the life cycle of the Switch is nearing its end. While no concrete evidence has been formally announced, a recent patent filing may give some insight into the company's efforts for current or next-gen software ideas.

According to a recently published patent, Nintendo is working on a software application that would allow save game data to be utilized in featured snapshots to be displayed along with cover art for a game on a home menu selection screen. Currently, if a player starts up their Nintendo Switch game console, they are shown a home menu listing each of their downloaded and/or inserted games, with the cover art of each game shown. With this newly patented software, users would be able to highlight the cover art displayed on the home menu and then look through a series of images based on their current progress in their existing save files for the selected game. While this software has the potential to greatly change the game selection process for the Nintendo Switch, there is currently no guarantee that this technology will ever be utilized.

Nintendo Game Selection Convenience Software Patent Details

Figure 3 of the Nintendo game selection convenience software patent shows how this system could change the Switch UI. Rather than only displaying a game's cover art, this software would include a number of in-game captures from manual and auto-save data. This could potentially streamline players' game selection, as they would not have to launch a title to check their current progress. The patent does not specify whether the software could be implemented exclusively on the existing Switch console or if it could possibly be a sneak peek at the user interface plans for the rumored Switch 2 device. However, without any official word from Nintendo, it remains to be seen if this game selection software will ever make its way to any existing or future Nintendo systems.

A number of major hardware and software patents for gaming consoles have been filed in recent months, revealing the research and development efforts of top brands. It is key to note that these companies frequently file patents that are never brought to fruition, so only time will tell if the Nintendo game selection convenience software will make its way to consumers.

item.title: Dark And Darker: 5 Overpowered Builds That Are A Lot Of Fun
item.description:
Highlights

  • Dark and Darker is a cooperative dungeon crawler primarily designed for small-group play with a lobby system for party formation.
  • The game offers limited weapon choices which simplifies decision-making process for players in combat situations.
  • Players can create overpowered character builds tailored for specific situations, such as solo play or party buffing roles.

Dark and Darker is an excellent cooperative dungeon crawler. Solo players can enjoy the game, but it is primarily aimed at small-group play. Using a lobby system, players can form a party in advance, or rely on the automated matching feature to head into a dungeon for some great hack-and-slash combat.

As with almost every multiplayer game that has a class system and skills, some players are able to create builds that are overpowered. These are either specialized builds for certain situations, such as 1v1 PvP, or generally overpowered builds that enable the player to steamroll most content. It is possible to design and create such builds in Dark and Darker, such as with the examples below.

5 Bad Boy Fighter

Simple And Effective

Stats:

  • Strength: 15
  • Agility: 15
  • Will: 15
  • Knowledge: 15
  • Resourcefulness: 15
  • Health: 100
  • Weight limit: 0
  • Spell memory: 16
  • Utility effectiveness: 0

This Fighter class build for Dark and Darker is incredibly simple, but works so well. It's overpowered in its ability to solo so much of the game's content. This is a sword-and-board style build that uses full plate armor and a heater shield. The weapon of choice is the Falchion. A torch and a few health and protection potions complete the gear loadout, while the necessary perks and skills combine tanking abilities with damage output.

Build Skills And Perks

  • Defense Expert: Increases Armor Rating acquired from armor by 10%.
  • Swift: Reduces base movement speed penalty from equipped armor by -20%. Not applicable to additional modifiers.
  • Barricade: When in a defensive stance, defense rating bonus is increased by 15%.
  • Projectile Resistance: Reduces damage taken from projectiles by 10%.
  • Second Wind: Recovers 50% of HP over 12 seconds. Additionally, it eliminates the side effects of the Adrenaline Rush skill.
  • Sprint: Movement speed is greatly increased for a short duration.

4 Ultimate Ranger

Massive Damage Output

Stats:

  • Strength: 10
  • Agility: 20
  • Will: 10
  • Knowledge: 10
  • Resourcefulness: 25
  • Health: 90
  • Weight limit: 0
  • Spell memory: 10
  • Utility effectiveness: 0

The Ranger class in Dark and Darker can be built to deal massive amounts of damage, and is overpowered in the way it drops enemies effortlessly from distance. This build is geared toward just such a result. The Longbow is used to good effect in this build, with an Arming Sword used as a backup melee weapon. The armor is a hybrid set, with a Warden outfit used for the chest, and various other light armor parts elsewhere. A pair of Rings of Courage help to boost stats, with a torch and suitable potions making up the rest of the loadout. Almost all of the perks this build uses are aimed at increasing DPS in some way.

Build Skills And Perks

  • Ranged Weapons Mastery: Increases physical attack power by 5% when attacking with a ranged weapon.
  • Sharpshooter: Headshot damage increases by 15% when attacking with a long-range weapon.
  • Kinesthesia: When moving with the bowstring drawn, movement speed increases by 10%.
  • Nimble Hands: When using a bow, change the default shooting animation so it shoots 15% faster.
  • Quickshot: Hold three arrows in your shooting hand and fire them quickly in succession in a single action.
  • Multishot: When attacking with a bow-type weapon, fire 5 arrows at a certain angle at the same time.

3 Party Buffing Bard

Adding Utility To The Team

Stats:

  • Strength: 15
  • Agility: 20
  • Will: 10
  • Knowledge: 18
  • Resourcefulness: 12
  • Health: 100
  • Weight limit: 0
  • Spell memory: 18
  • Utility effectiveness: 0

A well-built Bard can be a huge boon to any party. The buffs that the Bard class brings to the table in Dark and Darker are extremely useful, frequently leading to an overpowered team. This build is the ultimate buffer Bard. Note that this build doesn’t rely on armor as a core component, so anything will work in the armor slots. The weapons are a Falchion in the main hand, and a One-Handed Crossbow in the offhand. A standard Crossbow is carried in the ranged weapon slot. All the skills and perks for this build are focused on party buffs.

Build Skills And Perks

  • Charismatic Performance: Upgrades a good performance into a perfect performance.
  • Dancing Feet: Increases movement speed by 10 when holding an instrument.
  • Story Teller: Give all party members close by a +3 will and knowledge buff.
  • Lore Mastery: A high-level understanding of objects increases all types of interaction speed by 25%.
  • Music Memory 1: Can store up to 4 sheet music space permits.
  • Music Memory 2: Can store up to 4 sheet music space permits.

2 Classic Stealth Rogue

Backstabbing Badness

Stats:

  • Strength: 8
  • Agility: 35
  • Will: 5
  • Knowledge: 12
  • Resourcefulness: 15
  • Health: 84
  • Weight limit: 0
  • Spell memory: 12
  • Utility effectiveness: 0

This Rogue class build for Dark and Darker boosts the class' agility as high as possible, overpowering most enemies in seconds. A pair of Rings of Quickness and a Fox Pendant help considerably with this. The necessary armor is all light, and the build dual wields a pair of Kriss Daggers. A pair of throwing knives, some bandages, and health potions complete the gear loadout. All the skills and perks this build relies on are intended to create a classic stealth Rogue, improving damage when emerging from stealth and decreasing the enemy's detection abilities.

Build Skills And Perks

  • Back Attack: Increases physical damage bonus by 30% when attacking from behind the target.
  • Ambush: First attack within 3s after stealthing deals 50% additional damage.
  • Hidden Pockets: Items worn in utility slots do not appear on the waist.
  • Stealth: If you are hiding, you can move 10 steps while crouching or slow walking.
  • Weakpoint Attack: When the next attack succeeds, it deals 50% additional weapon damage to the target. If the hit is successful, the target's defense is reduced by 50% for 5 seconds.
  • Hide: Become invisible. It is possible to change your equipment in this state. You are revealed when you attempt an action, such as moving, attacking, or using a skill, lasting for 50 seconds.

1 Tanky Cleric

Survivability And Improved Healing

Stats:

  • Strength: 13
  • Agility: 11
  • Will: 30
  • Knowledge: 12
  • Resourcefulness: 8
  • Health: 96
  • Weight limit: 0
  • Spell memory: 12
  • Utility effectiveness: 0

The Cleric is a healing class in Dark and Darker, and this build stacks willpower to ensure that healing is as much as it can be, creating an overpowered Cleric that can survive even the most intense battles. The two Rings of Courage and the Badger Pendant help to boost stats overall. The build's armor is all plate, with excellent defenses throughout. This is a sword-and-board build (well, a mace in this case), equipped with a Morning Star and Heater Shield. The Cleric’s Spell Book takes up the additional weapon slot. The perks and skills for this Cleric build are split between healing potency, damage mitigation, and damage output in this role-playing game.

Build Skills And Perks

  • Advanced Healer: Increases the base magical heal by 5.
  • Kindness: Heal yourself for 15% of the spell's total heal amount when healing another target.
  • Perseverance: Reduces all types of incoming damage by 3.
  • Blunt Weapon Mastery: Increases physical attack power by 5% when attacking with a blunt weapon.
  • Judgement: After focusing for 0.5 seconds, immediately deals 35 magic damage to a target and reduces their movement speed bonus by 20% for 2 seconds.
  • Spell Memory 1: Allows memorizing spells to use in the dungeon.
